intro: Junellia diversifolia, commonly known as the diverse-leaved junellia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are deeply lobed and vary in shape across different individuals. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or red and bloom during the wet season. Junellia diversifolia is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and riverbanks.
